t: Isaiah 26
You Keep Him in Perfect Peace
In*p that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: “We*pn have a strong city; he*ld sets up salvation as*ld walls and bulwarks.
Open*ln the gates, that*ld the righteous nation that keeps faith may enter in.
You*ln keep him in perfect peace whose*ld mind is stayed on you, because*ld he trusts in you.
Trust*ln in the Lord*s forever, for*ld the Lord*s God*s is an everlasting rock.
For*ln he has humbled the*ld inhabitants of the height, the*ld lofty city. He*ln lays it low, lays it low to the ground, casts*ld it to the dust.
The*ln foot tramples it, the*ld feet of the poor, the*ld steps of the needy.”
The*pn path of the righteous is level; you*ld make level the way of the righteous.
In*ln the path of your judgments, O*ld Lord,*s we wait for you; your*ln name and remembrance are*ld the desire of our soul.
My*ln soul yearns for you in the night; my*ld spirit within me earnestly seeks you. For*ln when your judgments are in the earth, the*ld inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
If*ln favor is shown to the wicked, he*ld does not learn righteousness; in*ln the land of uprightness he deals corruptly and*ld does not see the majesty of the Lord.*s
O*ln Lord,*s your hand is lifted up, but*ld they do not see it. Let*ln them see your zeal for your people, and be ashamed. Let*ld the fire for your adversaries consume them.
O*ln Lord,*s you will ordain peace for us, for*ld you have indeed done for us all our works.
O*ln Lord*s our God, other*ld lords besides you have ruled over us, but*ld your name alone we bring to remembrance.
They*ln are dead, they will not live; they*ld are shades, they will not arise; to*ln that end you have visited them with destruction and*ld wiped out all remembrance of them.
But*ln you have increased the nation, O Lord,*s you*ld have increased the nation; you are glorified; you*ld have enlarged all the borders of the land.
O*pn Lord,*s in distress they sought you; they*ld poured out a whispered prayer when*ld your discipline was upon them.
Like*ln a pregnant woman who*ld writhes and cries out in her pangs when*ld she is near to giving birth, so*ln were we because of you, O Lord;*s
we*ld were pregnant, we writhed, but*ld we have given birth to wind. We*ln have accomplished no deliverance in the earth, and*ld the inhabitants of the world have not fallen.
Your*ln dead shall live; their bodies shall rise. You*ld who dwell in the dust, awake and sing for joy! For*ln your dew is a dew of light, and*ld the earth will give birth to the dead.
Come,*pn my people, enter your chambers, and*ld shut your doors behind you; hide*ln yourselves for a little while until*ld the fury has passed by.

For*ln behold, the Lord*s is coming out from his place to*ld punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity, and*ln the earth will disclose the blood shed on it, and*ld will no more cover its slain.
